alert.note: Alert for Coles; Cumberland (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 3:28AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coles and northern Cumberland Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 328 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mattoon, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Charleston around 340 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Rardin, Ashmore and Oakland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 between mile markers 175 and 195. Interstate 70 between mile markers 125 and 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 AM CDT for east central Illinois.
